title: Élodie Ramos
text:
Élodie Ramos (born 13 March 1983, in <a href="Aix%20en%20Provence">Aix en Provence</a>) is a French <a href="association%20football">football</a> player currently playing for <a href="Montpellier%20HSC%20%28Ladies%29">Montpellier HSC</a> of the <a href="Division%201%20F%C3%A9minine">Division 1 Féminine</a>. Ramos plays as a <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> and is currently one of the longest-serving players at the club, whom she joined in 2002.
Career.
Ramos began her career at her hometown club USM Meyreuil in the <a href="Communes%20of%20France">commune</a> of <a href="Meyreuil">Meyreuil</a>. After spending nine years at the club, she moved to nearby <a href="Marseille">Marseille</a> joining Celtic Marseille. After spending a few years in the club's youth system, she played one season on the senior team before moving north to the <a href="Alsace">Alsace</a> <a href="Regions%20of%20France">region</a> joining <a href="SC%20Schiltigheim">SC Schiltigheim</a>. In her only season with Schiltigheim, she scored 13 goals. Following a successful season, Ramos joined <a href="Montpellier%20HSC%20%28Ladies%29">Montpellier</a>. With Montpellier, she became an instant hit becoming one of the club's most decorated players having won the D1 Féminine on two occasions (2004 and 2005), as well as the <a href="Coupe%20de%20France">Challenge de France</a> in 2009. In her eight seasons with Montpellier, Ramos has scored double-digit goals in six and has only collected three yellow cards.
International career.
Ramos made her international debut on 22 February 2002 against <a href="China%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">China</a>. She scored her only international goal to date on 14 March 2007 in a 1–3 loss to <a href="Sweden%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Sweden</a> at the <a href="2007%20Algarve%20Cup">Algarve Cup</a>.
